newsitem.title: UK: BSkyB shares continue record run.
newsitem.headline: BSkyB shares continue record run.

text.p: Shares in BSkyB gained over three percent on Tuesday as investors continued to pour funds into the satellite broadcaster.
BSkyB shares touched a record 680p in early trade but settled back to trade at 674-1/2p, up 16p on the day. The stock has risen more than 65 percent since the start of the year.
Dealers said the stock continued to benefit from talks of tie-ups, a short squeeze and still-simmering interest in communications and broadcasting stocks.
"Basically, all the funds are getting in there and they're buying on the slightest sign of weakness," one marketmaker said.
By 0955 GMT over 3.8 million shares had changed hands.
Others said the stock had been pushed by talk a German broadcaster was interested in buying five percent of BSkyB while others pointed to bullish analyst comment.
"People are just scared of being left behind on this stock and it shows no signs of coming off," a second dealer said.
